Adult (Whistling).description: Tundra Swans are smaller than Trumpeter Swans with a small yellow patch in front of the eye. The area where the bill meets the head is V-shaped on Trumpeter Swans but U-shaped on Tundra Swans.

Juvenile (Whistling).description: Tundra Swans are smaller than Trumpeter Swans. Juveniles have pink at the base of the bill unlike juvenile Trumpeter Swans, which have a dark base of the bill.

Adult.description: Mute Swans hold their neck with more of a curve than Trumpeter Swans and they have an orange (not black) bill.

Immature.description: Immature Mute Swans have a pinkish gray bill while immature Trumpeter Swans have a darker bill.

Adult white morph.description: Snow Geese are much smaller than Trumpeter Swans with a smaller pink bill.
